p: Compared to inpatients with community-acquired RSV-associated ALRIs, those with nosocomial infections were more frequently adults (p = 0.0005) and subjects with at least one CCC (p < 0.0001). The rates of viral and bacterial co-/supra-infections, oxygen/ventilation requirement, ICU admissions, antibiotic treatments and deaths did not differ between inpatients diagnosed with community-acquired versus nosocomial infections. However, the length of stay was statistically longer in the latter than in the former (p < 0.0001).
